basics.name: Mateo Avila Pava
basics.label: MSc Student of Medical Robotics at FAU
basics.summary: I am a responsible, dedicated, and committed person, passionate about Soccer and Artificial Intelligence. I like tackling new challenges and staying at the forefront of advancements in AI and robotics. With experience as a Data Scientist and Deep Learning Engineer, and ongoing Master's research focused on Evolutionary NAS, I embrace a proactive approach to my work. My daily motivation comes from my family, my thirst for knowledge, and my drive to apply cutting-edge technologies to help solving the problems our society faces.

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
